alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 10:25AM PST until December 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... .Another round of precipitation will spread across the region this afternoon and evening. Snow levels will generally be near or above 4000 feet, which will confine heavy snowfall to northern Trinity County. However, colder air will spread across the region Friday, with snow levels falling to around 2500 to 3000 feet. Snow levels will fall even further during the weekend into early next week and will aid in substantial mountain snowfall across northwest California during the Christmas holiday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 14 inches. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
